DataElement.preferredName: Patient Newly Diagnosed World Health Organization Classification de novo Acute Myeloid Leukemia Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates the patient meets the eligibility requirements for participation in a clinical trial with regards to weather a patient is newly diagnosed with AML according to the World Health Organization classification with Yes No indicator.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Newly Diagnosed World Health Organization Classification de novo Acute Myeloid Leukemia Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Very recently determined._A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics._Anew, afresh, or over again from the beginning._A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification)._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Newly Diagnosed World Health Organization Classification de novo Acute Myeloid Leukemia Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Very recently determined.:A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services.:A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.:Anew, afresh, or over again from the beginning.:A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification).:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.
Anew, afresh, or over again from the beginning.

A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification).
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient newly diagnosed wi
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient newly diagnosed with de novo AML according to the 2016 WHO classification with or without extramedullary disease?
